title: How to Draw a Pharaoh

steps.headline: Start with two trapezoids and two ovals.
steps.description: The ovals should overlap at the top, but the trapezoids should touch.

steps.headline: Draw four ovals, two on each side of the top trapezoid.
Draw two rectangles at the bottom of the image.
Add two triangles at the bottom of the image.
steps.description: Add another at the top (this will become hair). Finally, draw a long thin rectangle to the right of the image.

steps.headline: Smooth out the image by connecting the shapes.
steps.description: Also draw a tusk shaped beard and add a nose.

steps.headline: Draw the rest of details.
steps.description: This includes eyes, a scepter, and the pattern of his headdress/belt.

text: Start with two trapezoids and two ovals. The ovals should overlap at the top, but the trapezoids should touch. Draw four ovals, two on each side of the top trapezoid. These will become arms. Draw two rectangles at the bottom of the image. These will become legs. Add two triangles at the bottom of the image. Add another at the top (this will become hair). Finally, draw a long thin rectangle to the right of the image. Smooth out the image by connecting the shapes. Also draw a tusk shaped beard and add a nose. Draw the rest of details. This includes eyes, a scepter, and the pattern of his headdress/belt. Erase unnecessary guidelines.  Color the image.  Finished.
